properties.name: camel.component.http.allow-java-serialized-object
properties.description: Whether to allow java serialization when a request uses context-type=application/x-java-serialized-object. This is by default turned off. If you enable this then be aware that Java will deserialize the incoming data from the request to Java and that can be a potential security risk.

properties.name: camel.component.http.auth-caching-disabled
properties.description: Disables authentication scheme caching

properties.name: camel.component.http.automatic-retries-disabled
properties.description: Disables automatic request recovery and re-execution

properties.name: camel.component.http.autowired-enabled
properties.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

properties.name: camel.component.http.client-connection-manager
properties.description: To use a custom and shared HttpClientConnectionManager to manage connections. If this has been configured then this is always used for all endpoints created by this component. The option is a org.apache.hc.client5.http.io.HttpClientConnectionManager type.

properties.name: camel.component.http.connect-timeout
properties.description: Determines the timeout until a new connection is fully established. A timeout value of zero is interpreted as an infinite timeout. The option is a org.apache.hc.core5.util.Timeout type.

properties.name: camel.component.http.connection-request-timeout
properties.description: Returns the connection lease request timeout used when requesting a connection from the connection manager. A timeout value of zero is interpreted as a disabled timeout. The option is a org.apache.hc.core5.util.Timeout type.

properties.name: camel.component.http.connection-state-disabled
properties.description: Disables connection state tracking

properties.name: camel.component.http.connection-time-to-live
properties.description: The time for connection to live, the time unit is millisecond, the default value is always keep alive.

properties.name: camel.component.http.connections-per-route
properties.description: The maximum number of connections per route.

properties.name: camel.component.http.content-compression-disabled
properties.description: Disables automatic content decompression

properties.name: camel.component.http.cookie-management-disabled
properties.description: Disables state (cookie) management

properties.name: camel.component.http.cookie-store
properties.description: To use a custom org.apache.hc.client5.http.cookie.CookieStore. By default the org.apache.hc.client5.http.cookie.BasicCookieStore is used which is an in-memory only cookie store. Notice if bridgeEndpoint=true then the cookie store is forced to be a noop cookie store as cookie shouldn't be stored as we are just bridging (eg acting as a proxy). The option is a org.apache.hc.client5.http.cookie.CookieStore type.

properties.name: camel.component.http.copy-headers
properties.description: If this option is true then IN exchange headers will be copied to OUT exchange headers according to copy strategy. Setting this to false, allows to only include the headers from the HTTP response (not propagating IN headers).

properties.name: camel.component.http.default-user-agent-disabled
properties.description: Disables the default user agent set by this builder if none has been provided by the user

properties.name: camel.component.http.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable auto configuration of the http component. This is enabled by default.

properties.name: camel.component.http.follow-redirects
properties.description: Whether to the HTTP request should follow redirects. By default the HTTP request does not follow redirects

properties.name: camel.component.http.header-filter-strategy
properties.description: To use a custom org.apache.camel.spi.HeaderFilterStrategy to filter header to and from Camel message. The option is a org.apache.camel.spi.HeaderFilterStrategy type.

properties.name: camel.component.http.http-binding
properties.description: To use a custom HttpBinding to control the mapping between Camel message and HttpClient. The option is a org.apache.camel.http.common.HttpBinding type.

properties.name: camel.component.http.http-client-configurer
properties.description: To use the custom HttpClientConfigurer to perform configuration of the HttpClient that will be used. The option is a org.apache.camel.component.http.HttpClientConfigurer type.

properties.name: camel.component.http.http-configuration
properties.description: To use the shared HttpConfiguration as base configuration. The option is a org.apache.camel.http.common.HttpConfiguration type.

properties.name: camel.component.http.http-context
properties.description: To use a custom org.apache.hc.core5.http.protocol.HttpContext when executing requests. The option is a org.apache.hc.core5.http.protocol.HttpContext type.

properties.name: camel.component.http.lazy-start-producer
properties.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

properties.name: camel.component.http.max-total-connections
properties.description: The maximum number of connections.

properties.name: camel.component.http.proxy-auth-domain
properties.description: Proxy authentication domain to use

properties.name: camel.component.http.proxy-auth-host
properties.description: Proxy authentication host

properties.name: camel.component.http.proxy-auth-method
properties.description: Proxy authentication method to use

properties.name: camel.component.http.proxy-auth-nt-host
properties.description: Proxy authentication domain (workstation name) to use with NTML

properties.name: camel.component.http.proxy-auth-password
properties.description: Proxy authentication password

properties.name: camel.component.http.proxy-auth-port
properties.description: Proxy authentication port

properties.name: camel.component.http.proxy-auth-scheme
properties.description: Proxy authentication protocol scheme

properties.name: camel.component.http.proxy-auth-username
properties.description: Proxy authentication username

properties.name: camel.component.http.redirect-handling-disabled
properties.description: Disables automatic redirect handling

properties.name: camel.component.http.response-payload-streaming-threshold
properties.description: This threshold in bytes controls whether the response payload should be stored in memory as a byte array or be streaming based. Set this to -1 to always use streaming mode.

properties.name: camel.component.http.response-timeout
properties.description: Determines the timeout until arrival of a response from the opposite endpoint. A timeout value of zero is interpreted as an infinite timeout. Please note that response timeout may be unsupported by HTTP transports with message multiplexing. The option is a org.apache.hc.core5.util.Timeout type.

properties.name: camel.component.http.skip-request-headers
properties.description: Whether to skip mapping all the Camel headers as HTTP request headers. If there are no data from Camel headers needed to be included in the HTTP request then this can avoid parsing overhead with many object allocations for the JVM garbage collector.

properties.name: camel.component.http.skip-response-headers
properties.description: Whether to skip mapping all the HTTP response headers to Camel headers. If there are no data needed from HTTP headers then this can avoid parsing overhead with many object allocations for the JVM garbage collector.

properties.name: camel.component.http.so-timeout
properties.description: Determines the default socket timeout value for blocking I/O operations. The option is a org.apache.hc.core5.util.Timeout type.

properties.name: camel.component.http.socket-timeout
properties.description: Determines the default socket timeout value for I/O operations. The option is a org.apache.hc.core5.util.Timeout type.

properties.name: camel.component.http.ssl-context-parameters
properties.description: To configure security using SSLContextParameters. Important: Only one instance of org.apache.camel.support.jsse.SSLContextParameters is supported per HttpComponent. If you need to use 2 or more different instances, you need to define a new HttpComponent per instance you need. The option is a org.apache.camel.support.jsse.SSLContextParameters type.

properties.name: camel.component.http.use-global-ssl-context-parameters
properties.description: Enable usage of global SSL context parameters.

properties.name: camel.component.http.x509-hostname-verifier
properties.description: To use a custom X509HostnameVerifier such as DefaultHostnameVerifier or NoopHostnameVerifier. The option is a javax.net.ssl.HostnameVerifier type.
